summary.para: Creates a new enumerator that contains the same enumeration state as the current one.

This method makes it possible to record a particular point in the enumeration sequence and then return to that point at a later time. The caller must release this new enumerator separately from the first enumerator.

param.name: ppEnum
param.para: A pointer to the interface pointer on the newly created enumerator. The caller must release this enumerator separately from the one from which it was cloned.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible values include the following.

description.para: Insufficient memory available for this operation.

summary.para: Retrieves the specified number of items in the enumeration sequence.

param.name: cViews
param.para: The number of items to be retrieved. If there are fewer than the requested number of items left in the sequence, this method retrieves the remaining elements.
If pcFetched is NULL, this parameter must be 1.

param.name: rgpView
param.para: The enumerator is responsible for calling , and the caller is responsible for calling through each pointer enumerated. If cViews is greater than 1, the caller must also pass a non-NULL pointer passed to pcFetched to know how many pointers to release.

param.name: pcFetched
param.para: The number of items that were retrieved. This parameter is always less than or equal to the number of items requested. This parameter can be NULL, in which case the cViews parameter must be 1.

returns.para: If the method retrieves the number of items requested, the return value is S_OK. Otherwise, it is S_FALSE.

remarks.para: E_NOTIMPL is not allowed as a return value. If an error value is returned, no entries in the rgpView array are valid and no calls to Release are required.

summary.para: Resets the enumeration sequence to the beginning.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success.

remarks.para: There is no guarantee that the same set of objects will be enumerated after the reset operation has completed. A static collection is reset to the beginning, but it can be too expensive for some collections, such as files in a directory, to guarantee this condition.

summary.para: Skips over the specified number of items in the enumeration sequence.

param.name: cViews
param.para: The number of items to be skipped.

returns.para: If the method skips the number of items requested, the return value is S_OK. Otherwise, it is S_FALSE.

summary.para: Enumerates the views supported by a document object.
